reviews.title: Recipe for Success!!
fine Food
reviews.text: Take the freshest, finest Irish ingredients, cooked by skilled French chefs, add a stunning location on Donegal Bay, and an extensive well priced wine list, and the recipe doen't get any better. Castlemurray House Restaurant was just a joy. From the skilled Maitre d' on arrival to the final cup of coffee, this is a restaurant that knows what it has to deliver. Assurred, elegant and respectful of the wonderful produce of Donegal, this is dining as it should be. We will be back!

We have been coming here for years & it is by far the best place we have eaten & stayed in the whole of Ireland ! The sea & mountain views from the restaurant, bedrooms are truely spectacular. The food is always consistantly superb & the staff are gracious & knowledgable on the food & wines they serve. This is a place to linger & stay awhile as it is hard to leave the fantastic surroundings & stupendeous scenery all around this hidden gem in the most scenic & unspoilt County in Ireland. Go there soon.
reviews.title: Best Restaurant in Donegal & Ireland.

reviews.text: If you ever have the opportunity to eat here, grab it with both hands and make sure you are hungry because you will be delighted with everything you get. The staff are wonderful and extremly accommodating, the decor is beautiful, the views are breath taking and well the food is just AMAZING. Truly a gem...
reviews.title: The best place to eat in Donegal maybe even Ireland

reviews.text: The food was absolutely excellent and the atmosphere is perfect, with several tables overlooking the bay. We were guests of the hotel, so we also had breakfast here: the irish breakfast was delicious and there was also a buffet of homemade croissants and bread, cereals, yogurt and jam. The staff was very friendly.

My wife and I ate dinner at Castle Murray to celebrate 10 years of marriage. The food was 5-star quality and the views are amazing. The seafood was extremely fresh. If you are a true "foodie", this is a great place to try. We were so full that we could not have dessert so they boxed up some homemade chocolate truffles to take home.
reviews.title: Fantasic experience!

reviews.text: 2 weeks ago a family group of 9 of us had a truly superb meal to celebrate a 90th birthday. From our arrival the staff could not have been more attentive or courteous. Every bite was declared delicious and the birthday girl was thrilled to have her dessert arrive complete with candles which was a very lovely surprise from the hotel! The table allocated to us was excellent - it was so nice to be seated around a circular table rather than a rectangular one - and the view from it was perfect. 4 of our party were from Scotland and 2 from America so they have all gone away with a great impression of Donegal in general and Castle Murray Hotel in particular. Hopefully some of us will be back again soon to enjoy the food, atmosphere and service - all of which was second to none.

reviews.text: The View is breathtaking, The food is created with pride and passion and every bite is mouthwatering.The monk and prawn starter is on the menu for years and I hope for many more years!!Even the glasses one drinks out of are top quality

I tried all weekend to find faults with Castlemurray, working in the service industry myself, I know that no place 'has it all'. Unfortunatley, Castlemurray has that and more. Ideally located between Killbegs and Donegal town, the views from the hotel of St. John's point and beyond are breath-taking. On arrival we were warmly greeted by lady of the house Marguerita Howley, who showed us to our room. Marguerita had a smile, a recommendation and a good story to tell us about everything in Donegal over our stay and even convinced us with her passion and energy to go out and see more of the Donegal nightlife than we had originally planned!
reviews.title: 5* quality accomodation, food and service with the warmth and of a local house hotel

reviews.text: The dining at Castlemurray is an experience in itself. If you don't have the time/opportunity to stay, at least go and have one of the most enjoyable meals of your life there. Heavily decorated with awards and accolades the french cusine lives up to its reputation consistently. Try the prawn and monkfish starter, any of the fish main courses and the belgian chocolate dessert. The service in the restaurant is impeccable, a true silver service feel, without any of the associated airs and graces of many 5* establishments. We ate at the restaurant in Castlemurray both nights we stayed out of sheer deisire to try more. The meals are a set menu, all in and very reasonably priced. Breakfast doesn't see Castlemurray miss a beat with homemde granola, warm crossiants and pastries and an award winning fry.
reviews.title: A fabulous place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are beautifully decorated, pictures on the websites will show you that they are all as exquisite and individual as each other. After a day walking the cliffs I was most overjoyed with the scorching power shower. Relaxing in the room with the wind and rain beating against the window made us realise, maybe Irish weather can be conducive to a relaxing weekend getaway if all the surroundings are as serene as Castlemurray!
reviews.title: What a relaxing and fantastic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Castle Murray is set on St. John's Point with incredible views of the sea and the mountains. It is a peaceful place. The rooms are pretty, the food is excellent, and the staff are friendly and helpful. The freshly caught fish - especially the black sole - is fantastic.
reviews.title: Another faultless trip to Castlemurray
Amazing food
reviews.text: There for anniversary 20/11-22/11, loved our room in the attic very romantic and all in all it was all we needed for a great weekend. Service was faultless especially bar/waiting staff, we were made very welcome and nothing was to much trouble. The food was to die for both the dinner and breakfast. Love the pain au chocolate, try them. All in all very relaxing and felt like a real treat.
back again with my family when on holidays in donegal . House special of monkfish and prawns was delightful. One thing though i think tea/coffee should be complimentary on the set menu .

reviews.text: As a travel consultant I get to travel every few weeks. I've stayed in all kind of properties all over the world and I have to say that this place was way up there with the 6* star hotels of Dubai. The personal service was fantastic and food to die for......I was very sad to leave and wished I could stay another night . I will most definitely be returning and will tell anyone who will listen that's it my newest favorite place:-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at Castle Murray House Hotel, and I honestly think it is one of the most friendly places to stay. From the mouthwatering food the breathtaking view and the standard of friendly but efficient service this hotel cannot be faulted. We went to celebrate our wedding anniversary, and it was so good we hated leaving to go back to the real world!! There are also lots of places to visit, thats if you can drag yourself away from the hotel. We will certainly be returning for another piece of heaven!!!
reviews.title: A little piece of heaven

We were on holiday for the week in glencholmcille and our meal in this hotel was certainly the highlight. The atmosphere as soon as you enter is very welcoming. The staff are very helpful and efficient. The presentation of the food was like a work of art and certainly delivered on flavour. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at Castle Murray after discovering it by accident in October 2008. What can we say the location and views were just amazing ! The food, staff, rooms all amazing too! It is by far one of the most amazing places we have stayed and will return again on our next trip to Ireland.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: We stayed at Castle Murray early March 2009 and I have been meaning to write a review since... Our stay was fantastic from beginning to end. Dinner was outstanding, my John Dory was excellent, we could not fault a thing. Our rooms (with views) were gorgeous, beautifully decorated with the most comfortable bed I have slept in. We woke up to a snow covered St. John's Point, (icing on the cake). Breakfast was again a lovely experience. I cannot convey enough what a great time we had, although we stayed only one night we left feeling truly relaxed. I am looking forward to a return visit!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay in a Beautiful Place

reviews.text: Hi Margoritte,

Just a quick thank you from myself and Celine for such an exceptional weekend we had recently at the Castle Murray Hotel. In a world of plastic four and five star hotels you and your staff have really renewed my faith in what it is that makes the Irish Hotel Welcome a treasure to be bestowed. I have been to world renowned accommodation throughout Europe including Villa De'este in Lake Como, Italy, and I assure you in terms of scenery and above all, hospitality, your establishment surpasses these.
